entries.meaning: (US, informal, historical) Secessionist, supportive of the Confederacy during the United States Civil War.
(US, informal, historical) A secessionist, a supporter of the Confederacy during the United States Civil War.
examples: [â€¦]  I think they buried more secesh than our folks.
Question. How did they bury them?
Answer. They buried the secesh over back of the fort, all except those on Fort Hill; them they buried up on top of the hill where the gunboats shelled them.
